segment.name: Beginning of message
segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit identifying number and the further specification of the message type (in data element 1001: Document name code), such as Empty container disposition order, Release order, Pre- arrival notice, Acceptance order, Empty container notice, Call- down order, On-hire request, On-hire order, Off-hire request, Off-hire notice.

segment.name: Transport movement details
segment.documentation: TMD, A segment to specify the haulage arrangement for the containers in the message, such as carrier haulage or merchant haulage.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time applying the message as a whole: - requested equipment positioning date and/or time - expected on-hire date and/or time - expected return period

segment.name: Transport service requirements
segment.documentation: TSR, A segment to identify whether arrangements for the inland transport are to be made, whether equipment guidelines are applicable, whether Customs clearance is to be arranged and pick-up/delivery instructions.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information - special instructions

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location applying to the entire message: - region of availability - empty equipment return region

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference relating to the whole message, and its date and/or time.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - container announcement reference number - booking reference number - reference to previous message - lessee's reference - lessor's reference - lease contract reference - return reference (of the party returning on hire equipment) - collect reference (of party collecting specified leased equipment) - carrier's agent reference number

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of containers by sea and by inland carriers, such as mode and means of transport, and locations.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to the main carriage stage of the transport (sea), such as voyage number or indication sea transport, vessel and carrier or liner. Information on related inland transport stage(s) can also be included, such as mode of inland transport, means of transport, and inland carrier, such as: - main-carriage transport (sea) - pre- or on-carriage transport - second pre- or on-carriage transport

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate the arrival date and time of an inland means of transport such as a place or port of discharge or loading.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to provide a reference for the liner service, such as: - conference - marketing organization - syndicate - vessel sharing agreement

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A segment group to indicate places and ports corresponding to a transport stage.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify a location associated with a transport stage such as final port or place of discharge or loading.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify a party and/or addresses and a related contact and references.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, and other addresses, such as: - ordering customer - ordering customer agent - message recipient - message sender - place of positioning - place of collection - final place of positioning - carrier agent (sea) - charges payer - place of acceptance name and address - invoicee - stripping address - return address - on hire party direct interchange - off hire party direct interchange - container survey agency

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department of a message sender and/or message recipient, such as: - information contact

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party or at an address, such as: - reference at place of collection - reference at place of positioning - related container announcement reference (reference to Container disposition order) - transport costs reference number - reference at stripping address - reference at return address - reference at place of acceptance

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time applying to the party, such as: - ultimate equipment positioning date/time - requested equipment positioning date/time

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: SG12 A group of segments to describe the goods items (to be) stuffed in or (to be) stripped from the containers.

segment.name: Goods item details
segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item (to be) stuffed in or (to be) stripped from the containers. A goods item can be identified by a goods item number.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions relating to the goods item, such as: - hazardous cargo - off-dimensions - Customs clearance

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to describe the goods item or to provide special instructions.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference to a goods item in case of export, such as: - shipowner's authorization number - declarant's reference number

segment.name: Additional product id
segment.documentation: PIA, A segment to identify a commodity code.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to describe the address, reference and date/time for the stuffing or the stripping of the goods item in the containers.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the address applicable to the particular goods item, such as: - place of positioning (as the stuffing or stripping address for the goods item) - Customs clearance place - place of acceptance name and address - stripping address

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time when the container is to be positioned, such as: - requested equipment positioning date/time - ultimate equipment positioning date/time

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party or at an address, such as: - reference at place of positioning - reference at place of acceptance - reference at stripping address

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to a goods item, such as: - gross weight

segment.name: Dimensions
segment.documentation: DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to a goods item, such as: - gross dimensions

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments to specify documents related to the goods item.

segment.name: Document/message details
segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to indicate a document related to the goods item.

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify the date/time related to the document, such as: - document/message date/time - expiry date.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a location related to the document, such as: - place of document issue

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments to specify the distribution of a goods item among the containers.

segment.name: Split goods placement
segment.documentation: SGP, A segment to identify a container in which goods are transported.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify the gross weight of that portion of the goods item in the container, such as: - gross weight - net net weight (dangerous goods)

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the dangerous goods regulations for the corresponding mode of transport, class of dangerous goods, additional dangerous goods code, UN-number and shipment flash point.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details related to the dangerous goods, such as: - dangerous goods technical name - dangerous goods additional information

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.name: Temperature
segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature as a range of values.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: FTX-PCD-SG15-MOA-GOR-EQA-COD-HAN-SG17-SG18- SG20 A group of segments to specify (groups of) containers (with guidelines) in which goods are transported or which are taken on-hire or off-hire.

segment.name: Equipment details
segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify a container, container size and type, and full/empty indication; also to specify the type of rail car on which a related container is transported.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the particular container, such as: - container sequence number - lower equipment serial number of range - upper equipment serial number of range - referring sequence number - reference at place of positioning - reference at place of collection - related container announcement reference (reference to Empty container disposition order) - transport costs reference number - carrier agent's reference number - freight forwarder's reference

segment.name: Number of units
segment.documentation: EQN, A segment to specify the number of containers of the same size and type in case of equipment guidelines.

segment.name: Transport movement details
segment.documentation: TMD, A segment to indicate a Full Container Load (FCL) or a Less than Full Container Load (LCL).

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the container, such as: - estimated positioning date/time - ultimate release date/time - expected on-hire date and/or time

segment.name: Transport service requirements
segment.documentation: TSR, A segment to specify special instructions and/or services regarding the container, such as: fork lift holes required, off-dimensions, ship's agent's counter by terminal, seals to be checked, damage to be inspected, Customs clearance.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify ports/locations associated with the sea transport of a container in case of export, such as: - place of discharge - transhipment place

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurement, other than dimensions, associated with the container, such as: - tare weight - gross weight

segment.name: Dimensions
segment.documentation: DIM, - off-standard dimensions, general - off-standard dimensions, front - off-standard dimensions, rear - off-standard dimensions, right - off-standard dimensions, left - off-standard dimensions, height - external equipment dimensions - dimensions equipment door - net dimensions

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings

segment.name: Temperature
segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the transport temperature setting of a container.

segment.name: Range details
segment.documentation: RNG, A segment to specify the transport temperature range or the pre-tripping range of a container.

segment.name: Seal number
segment.documentation: SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the container, such as shipper, consolidator, carrier (sea) and Customs.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with the container, such as: - loading instructions (seagoing vessel) - special instructions (related to inland transport) - container order information (conditions to be checked) - remarks

segment.name: Percentage details
segment.documentation: PCD, A segment to specify percentages related to the equipment such as percentage humidity.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A segment group to identify dangerous goods.

segment.name: Dangerous goods
segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify dangerous goods.

segment.name: Free text
segment.documentation: FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as the technical name of the dangerous goods etc.

segment.name: Measurements
segment.documentation: MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segment.name: Monetary amount
segment.documentation: MOA, A segment to indicate a liability amount relating to the equipment.

segment.name: Governmental requirements
segment.documentation: GOR, A segment to indicate if governmental inspection is required.

segment.name: Attached equipment
segment.documentation: EQA, A segment to identify related container and means of transport details (rail), such as: - rail car (to relate to the 'rail-car'-qualified EQD-group)

segment.name: Component details
segment.documentation: COD, A segment to specify the details of the components of transport equipment.

segment.name: Handling instructions
segment.documentation: HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions related to the container equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments to specify damage details related to the equipment.

segment.name: Damage
segment.documentation: DAM, A segment to specify equipment damages, such as the point of the damage on the equipment, and the type of damage.

segment.name: Component details
segment.documentation: COD, A segment to specify component details of the damaged equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments to indicate information related to the pre- or on-carriage transport stage of the equipment.

segment.name: Transport information
segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to specify pre- or on-carriage transport details, such as: * pre- or on-carriage transport * second pre- or on-carriage transport

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify a date and time related to the pre- or on-carriage transport such as arrival or departure date and time.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 19: A segment group to specify ports and other locations associated with pre- or on-carriage transport.

segment.name: Place/location identification
segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify ports/locations associated with the pre- or on-carriage transport, such as: - place of departure - place of arrival

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to specify date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments to identify different parties/places, and related dates/times.

segment.name: Name and address
segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify a related address or party, such as: - charges payer - country/place of container stuffing - place of collection - final place of positioning - message to - next destination - release to party - carrier agent (sea) - return address

segment.name: Date/time/period
segment.documentation: DTM, A segment to indicate a date and time relating to the container, such as: - earliest equipment collection date/time

segment.name: Contact information
segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department for the specified party.

segment.name: Communication contact
segment.documentation: COM, A segment to identify the communication number on the EDI-network (e.g. mailbox number) to whom a copy of the Container gate-in/gate-out report message should be sent.

segment.name: Reference
segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party or at an address: - reference at return address

segment.name: Control total
segment.documentation: CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
